summary: Interactive romantic single-page Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No choice, evasive No button, and a Yes-triggered cartoonish meme image + love message; designed to run locally on iPad Chrome.
architectural_notes: Implement as a single self-contained static HTML page with embedded CSS/JS (no backend) for easy local use on iPad Chrome.
known_issues: Production deployment error occurred during deployment ("Deployment error" while going live with draft Version 8).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style cartoon romantic illustration with a couple, hearts/sparkles, warm pink/red palette, playful vector-like outlines, and embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” (valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png, 1600x900)

existing_features.title: Deliver a simple, single-purpose Valentine proposal experience that asks the user: “Will you be my Valentine, my love?” and presents exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”.

Implement the evasive “No” interaction so that the “No” button cannot be clicked: when the user hovers over it with a mouse OR attempts to touch/press it via touch/pointer on iPad, the button moves to a new random position within its container bounds and does not overlap the “Yes” button.

On clicking “Yes”, switch to a celebration/reveal view that (a) displays a cartoonish romantic meme image containing the text “You are my forever, Warda” and (b) shows the user-provided love letter text in a readable, scroll-friendly layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic visual theme across both the prompt and celebration views (warm pink/red palette, playful rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, and a friendly cartoon-like typographic feel), while keeping the UI simple and focused.

Provide the experience as a self-contained static page runnable in iPad Chrome by maintaining/updating the standalone file at frontend/public/valentine.html (HTML/CSS/JS) and ensure the meme image is referenced as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.
